Bandwidth
Methods

Lots of data, low bandwidth

DATA COMPARISON

In order to support multiple data transmissions between Earth and Mars, it is necessary to have a wireless mechanism to send the data, below, a comparison can be made between the current methods of data transmission and the methods that are planned to be developed in the future, including the Li-Fi solution proposed by us from the Minnoctlevis team, using the FTLC mechanisms.  

Technology Maximum Data Range
Current Technology
IEEE 802.11.ax 14Gbps
Bluetooth 5.0 2Mbps
WiMax 30-40Mbps
Future Technology
WiGig 8Gbps
Li-Fi >200Gbps (With Experiments)

data analysis

With the table above, we see that the two mechanisms that stand out the most are the IEEE 802.11.ax and Li-Fi technologies. The IEEE 802.11ax standard is still the best option compared to Bluetooth and WiMax, because besides operating at 2.5GHz and 5GHz, it also has an improved infrastructure compared to its previous standards and has a wider signal reception, which can be used in airports and large scale housing buildings. Its disadvantage compared to Li-FI technology is related to data transmission in dead zones, i.e., underground locations, for example, has few conditions to receive a signal of this type of technology.
On the other hand, we have the Li-FI technology, its advantage is that it is much cheaper than other technology, because it is operated through the transmission of light in LED lamps. However, its disadvantage against the IEEE 802.11 standards is in relation to the passage of signal in closed places, this type of signal can not overcome solid walls, in the best option, it would be necessary to make adjustments in the electrical networks so that the lamps follow a "path" to transmit the data correctly.
Because of this, FTLC adds both IEEE 802.11 technology. ax technology as well as Li-Fi technology in terms of wireless. connections, this way it is possible to create an efficient solution that will not be necessary to restructure the entire terrestrial and martian transmission network and at the same time it can be used in places that could not receive signals because they are considered dead zones or have eminent risks for the people who are in the place because of the transmitted radio wave, thus giving a greater comfort to the population of Mars and a much higher and faster data transmission success rate than with the current technology.
